name: superhumanly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that suggests that someone has more powers than a human: He hasn't weakened with age; in fact, he has grown superhumanly tough. Gargantax was a true giant: several feet taller than most, he was superhumanly strong and unnaturally fast on his feet.
More examplesFewer examplesThe B minor Sonata was precise, intense, and superhumanly fast in the climax.The superhumanly cool Christopher Owen portrays our ruthless hero.The Browns were meant to represent a real family when, in truth, they were superhumanly unpleasant.
